Description: Fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows darker discolouration. The rear shows a convex impression like from a vessel or similar object, in the break two impressions of a turned cord with a width of 0.30 cm. The front side is slightly concave and covered by finger impressions. In the upper part a seal-impressions, only the upper half is preserved. At the left a figure is facing towards the right, seems to be a stylized falcon headed god with a sun-disc above the head, the figure on the right is Amun, wearing the double feather crown, facing to the left and holding a wAs-sceptre in front of him. The rest is broken off. Black accretions on the surface. Same motif as EA86806.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
